Reviews.Title: “Mahomed”
Reviews.Author: Mahomed G
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with friendly and very helpful staff, hotel is located in a brilliant location near the historical places in Istanbul. The breakfast is excellent and staff will go out of their way to ensure you have enjoyed the breakfast and anything extra you ask for is not a problem, however breakfast could do with more variety of items on different days. Overall my son and I had a brilliant holiday and would recommend this hotel to anyone with a family looking for an ideal location in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Dominik125
Reviews.Content: Overall a very good experience with excellent location and very helpful staff. Good value for money. However if you book a triple room be aware that you may get a double room with an extra bed which is not really suitable for an adult! In addition, if you are "light sensitive", be also aware that the curtains are too few to protect from light in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: gio_s464
Reviews.Content: With my gf, we decided to meet in Istanbul, to make a touristic tour, see the historical side of Ä°stanbul and take photos. We wanted to find an hotel in the center of Sultanahmet, with a nice quality and location. After we made a search in web and read the comments, we chose Sultan House. And didn't feel any regret in any second, during our accomodation. Rooms were clean, breakfast was nice, staff was warm-blooded and welcoming. Most importantly, location was greater than we expected. Staff also acted in good faith about our airport transfer. Shortly, it was a really nice experience for us. And I can recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a cozy hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel in Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Christina C
Reviews.Content: Great service, clean and cozy rooms. My friends who are not usually comfortable with smaller hotels or hostels were impressed with Sultan House! The hotel is close to Blue Mosque, the main train, walkable distance to Grand Bazaar. Overall great place for great value!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Walid T
Reviews.Content: It was really good hotel, with service and breakfast. It was really good location which was close to everything, specially the blue mosque. and center.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtndew808
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Sultan house for 3 nights in February 2012 was wonderful. The hotel location couldn't have been better being a 2 minute walk from the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, and Hagia Sophia. Breakfast was also excellent with selections of meats, cheeses, pastries, fruits, and olives. The rooms were on the larger size for European standards and spotless. The beds were hard which I prefer, however my wife wasn't as comfortable. The only minor complaint we had was our safe did not work and after twice asking for assistance we gave up and put our passports and valuables in our friend's safe who were staying in the room next to ours. Overall our trip couldn't have been better. The staff at the Sultan House were extremely friendly and polite, rooms were comfortable and clean, and breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul Trip”
Reviews.Author: Osman E
Reviews.Content: stay was wonderful. staff was very friendly, location is perfecht to visit blue mosque, Ayasofya and dikilitas. it is 2 minutes walk. Breakfast was delicious, rooms are cleaned. prices are very affordable at the location. we were group of friends from the Netherlands. This hotel is definitely recommended. next trip to Istanbul, I will certainly choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent”
Reviews.Author: Yusuf O
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is Exellent. Very Good. and Super.I have not a Problem. The breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “LIVE YOUR DREAM IN TURKEY IN "SULTAN HOUSE"!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marialysa
Reviews.Content: The 4 days we spent in Istanbul was a dream!Sultan House is a highly suggested hotel in the traditional town of Sultanahmet especially if it is your 1st time in Istanbul!Just 5-minute-walking from all the most breathtaking monuments(Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace,Basilica Cisterna,the old Hippodrome)-and another 5 min.from the nearest tram station(perfect for your transportation in the city)-excellent service and hospitality(the friendliness of the young man in the reception was worthy to be mentioned!-not to forget the young man serving breakfast,of course!)So guys thank you for everything!We're looking forward to our second time in magic Istanbul...

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: zakirah m
Reviews.Content: i love the hotel it is classy and is very nice and the breakfast is very very excellent

Reviews.Title: “excelent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: huma s
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at sultan house ,was an excellent experience entire staff at hotel was extremely helpfful went out of their way to make us feel at home rooms were clean comfatable it felt like home

Reviews.Title: “Such a helpful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sara R
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing trip thanks to the hotel, and hotel staff. The rooms were clean, and the hotel staff were so sweet! They helped us plan our day trips, find amazing food, and figure out the metro. They have incredible service. The hotel is also very conveniently located to many of the major sites (Blue Mosque) and a bazaar, so it's a great place to walk around any time.

Reviews.Title: “Second time, much better than the first!!!”
Reviews.Author: ali_radfard
Reviews.Content: This small beauty looks just like one's home. I am telling the truth if I say it was so so friendly ... Value for money is well met here indeed. Being in the old part of the city, it is just 5 minutes walk from hagia Sofia mosque. Metro and tramova right here... Just try

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in boutique hotel with excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas P
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Sultan House for one night in early December 2011 as part of a much longer trip (16 other hotels in many countries). The Sultan House seemed very reasonably priced given its cleanliness, internet access, tasty breakfast, and convenience to Istanbul's leading tourist attractions. The staff was helpful in directing me to local services (barber and tailor) that I needed in what was a break from a busy itinerary. I hope to return there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly clean and homely”
Reviews.Author: Baykush
Reviews.Content: The minute we walked in we were welcomed and greeted by Yunus who showed us our room. The room was very clean and homely. Open buffet breakfast in the morning was great. We could help ourselves for coffee any time of the day in the loby and the breakfast room. We walked everywhere as it was very close to historical places,mosques and shops. We visit Istanbul often for short breaks and shopping,we will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy for attractions and very clean..”
Reviews.Author: villaclub
Reviews.Content: Small hotel but we were very happy as the room was very clean and very homeley. The location was perfect as the Blue Mosque, shops, grand bazaar and the tram was just round the corner. Internet was free and it was working well which is very important to me. We only stayed 2 nights but we will return

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: bridgemagoo2
Reviews.Content: Lots of good things about this hotel but top of the list is the location, just a very short walk from the Blue Mosque, Islamic Arts Museum. So much is within walking distance in Istanbul anyway but here you are close to two tram stops as well as everything else. This small hotel is clean, staff are friendly and helpful and at 59 Euros a night double room and breakfast (early December) reasonably priced. Looking at other reviews, frankly if you are upset by new "Ikea style" furniture, or your half used shampoo not being refilled every day, then you should be in a much more expensive hotel or possibly not in Istanbul at all. We had a slight problem with the room heater not working and Yunus moved us straight away with the minimum of fuss to an even nicer room. The room was very comfortable, breakfast was a buffet style selection of cheeses, olives etc with some hot eggs and frankfurters but plenty of choice. Overall I would happily return and can thoroughly recommend this small well run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cozy place”
Reviews.Author: Sepideh1982
Reviews.Content: we spent quiet and beautiful time at hotel sultan house , everybody is so helpful and friendly.it was clean and cozy.if you prefer to stay in small places like me this can be a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Overrated - Failed to meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: MasterLuke11
Reviews.Content: Sultan House failed to meet expectations of an establishment that keeps getting 5-star reviews. I am very disappointed with my decision to choose this place solely on the other reviews. I should have done my homework and considered the many other better hotels in the immediate area. Although this place is called "Hotel Sultan House," it really is not a full service hotel. It is more like a guesthouse with fewer than nine (9) rooms in the entire establishment. There's a room in the basement (yes, that's right), one right next to the lobby and dining area, and three (3) each on the second floor and third floors. I don't know who would want the room in the lobby, although this room was never available during my stay. Yunus, the hotel manager, used it for his personal room and slept in it every night that I stayed there. When I first checked in, Yunus had me sit down on the couch in the lobby and go over the highlights and tourist areas of Istanbul. This was helpful. But then he launched into his sales pitch with the brochures of company tours, dinner shows and other tourist traps. If that wasn't enough, Yunus offered to give provide a free shuttle ride back to the airport if I paid for my stay in cash. This was a first for me. I don't know what Yunus' game was. Was he planning to not report the income to the government or maybe just personally line his pocket? Who knows. Just tacky. The rooms are small, the bathrooms are even smaller, tiny in fact. No bathtub in the room, only a small shower. Sultan House is located on a corner and you will here everything going on outside on the street. The room lack any garbage cans, except for the tiny one in the bathroom. A request for an iron and ironing board went unfulfilled. The furnishings looked and felt cheap. But the hotel was clean. The rooms were made up in a timely manner. Yunus seemed pleasant upon arrival and departure. During the rest of the stay in-between, he wasn't the friendliest person. I caught him chatting it up with his facebook friends a few times. Don't bother Yunus during these sessions because he just ignores you. Yunus did provide some incorrect information regarding transportation and operating hours of local tourist sites. Service was not world class. Some of his recommendations were off the mark. Yunus also advised another guest that he should go to HaydarpaÅŸa Rail Station to catch a train to somewhere in Europe. Well, unless a rail crossing was miraculously built to connect the European and Asian sides of Istanbul, this wasn't going to happen. Yunus should have known that HaydarpaÅŸa Station only serves rail lines to Asia. For destinations in Europe, you need to go to the famous Sirkeci Rail Terminal, the terminus for the Orient Express. Amazingly, Yunus didn't know this. Continental breakfast was provided with the stay. It was not great, but it was not bad either. Very limited, just olives, cheese, cucumber, tomatoes, and cold cuts. Nothing substantial. Just don't rely on it to fill you up. You'll be hungry in half an hour after leaving the hotel and will need to get a simit to hold you over. I can't believe they didn't offer any simit with breakfast. This is the most traditional of Turkish breakfasts -- simit with tea. The few number of rooms and guests is probably the main factor with the limited breakfast choices. The best thing going for Sultan House is the location. It's located minutes near the major tourist sites. But, the immediate surrounding area is not the best. Abandoned buildings are scattering around. I wanted to see the ruins, not live among it. The streets are narrow with few restaurants. There's one restaurant around the corner that Yunus recommended. But, that turned out to be an overpriced tourist trap. There's a lot of tourist vehicular traffic during the day. There are better hotels and restaurants 5 minutes away in a much better neighbor, all around Kucuk Ayasofya Rd. The "staff" consists of 3 people - Yunus, the overnight guy and the maid. That's it. The overnight guy is nice, but he doesn't speak anything other than Turkish. So, if you ever needed anything, he had to go into the guestroom in the lobby and wake up Yunus to get assistance. During one midday break, I went back to the Sultan House for a rest. But, I found the front door locked and I couldn't enter the establishment. They probably didn't have anyone available to work the reception area and so, they lock the place up? Yunus subsequently appeared and opened the door after he heard my banging. He was probably was doing the deed on the porcelain throne. But that's no reason to bunker down the entire establishment. This place is no oasis. It misses the mark so often, it's ridiculous. Place is run by amateurs. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else where you'll get better service, comfort, and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Andriani_11
Reviews.Content: Staying in a clean place was our top priority. After staying in a 5 stars hotel in another part of Turkey just before staying at the Sultan House hotel, and seeing some rubbish lying around across the street from the hotel, we were happy to see actually inside the Sultan House hotel was clean, even though it was quite small. The location was good, close to tourist attractions. The staff were quite helpful and friendly. We stayed there for 2 nights, but not in a row. We were thankful we could leave our luggage at the hotel when we checked in very early to join the tour, and left 2 nights for touring in another part of Turkey. We were thankful to see our luggage were in the room when we came back from the tours. We would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Peter R
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed for 6 nights on a family holiday. We were accommodated in the "penthouse suite at' the top of the hotel. This consists of two adjoining rooms with an en suite bathroom and a kitchen unit in one room. It was very quiet apart from one night when the generator, which is very close, cut in several times because of power cuts. The door into the en suite is very low because it is built into the roof space, but it isn't a big deal. As others have said, the location is superb, the hotel is very clean and the breakfasts more than adequate. Yunus, as mentioned elsewhere, is really helpful and seems to work night and day. We felt the hotel was good value and would certainly endorse the recommendations of other travellers. Finally, there is an excellent small restaurant just 50 metres down the road which is very good value and became our family favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Angela_V2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Sultanhouse on a city break-out trip and enjoyed it very much. The hotel is a small, family run hotel within walking distance of all major sites and still in a quiet location. We could even go "home" during the day to rest a little bit. The rooms are small but everything is clean. The airport pick-up works well and Yunus is really helpful when it comes to giving advice on trips, shopping. If you like travelling like the local people use the tram - station is not far - and cross Galata Bridge with it, great view and good sightseeing if not at busy hours. Also the ferries/boats to Asian side go every 20 min. from EminÃ¶mÅ± to ÃœsdÃ¼kar for example. Having dinner in one of the restaurants under Galata Bridge is a great experience. We would like to thank Yunus and the whole staff for our pleasant stay !

Reviews.Title: “The most pleasant hotel was like a home”
Reviews.Author: CaptainTrenchard
Reviews.Content: This is what you call a small boutique hotel with a charming homely feel. From the day we got there we were made to feel very welcome. Whatever we needed they were happy to accommodate. Our little 2 year old lad loved Istanbul and this hotel and grew quite fond of Yunus the hotel manager. Yunus was always extemely helpful and really helped us plan our holiday to ensure we saw everything. Yunus thanks for making our stay delightful and i hope your future dreams come true

Reviews.Title: “Really great service, lovely people, great spot”
Reviews.Author: artslut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sultan House for four days. The rooms are small, but -given my limited experience- this seems quite typical for hotels in this part of Istanbul. We tried two different rooms including the "penthouse". Although the walls -especially in the bedroom- slope in because it is the rooftop suite, it was overall a little more roomy than the other room and included a sitting area. If you can afford the extra expense I recommend this room. One of my fondest memories was having a lazy morning sitting on our cool sitting room listening to birds. It was a lot more peaceful than other hotels we stayed in. Yunus and his colleagues were really tremendous and worked very hard for us, even booking tickets so that we could see a football game "TURKIYE!". They were very accommodating and I can't say enough about how helpful they were. If we stayed in Sultanahmet again we would definitely stay here again. It was clean, peaceful and we were made to fell very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: artsluts
Reviews.Content: A gem of a boutique hotel in central Istanbul. Despite being only a block away from the popular Hippodrome and all the tourist trappings, the Sultan House is a peaceful, pleasant place to stay. The rooms are spotlessly clean, although a little small. A simple breakfast buffet is served every morning. The hotel is open 24 hours which is very convenient. What really sets this hotel apart, however, is the excellent service from the staff. Front desk manager Yunus is a star; always available, always welcoming and friendly. From recommending attractions to helping us book football tickets, he went above and beyond. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet, central place to call "home" while exploring Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but avarage quality to premium prices”
Reviews.Author: sunem70
Reviews.Content: Great location, but avarage quality to premium prices. We where staying for three days and have booked a room for four people to a premium price. The doublebed was a temporary bed and not the best to sleep on. Bathroom was very small (see picture). Further there was not room for storing clothes except for a few hangers. Breakfast was ok, but no fresh juice (?)

Reviews.Title: “Girls trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had a wonderful four day trip in Istanbul and the Sultan House Hotel, together with its friendly, helpful staff, was the main reason for this. We were in the basement, in economy rooms, but they were still extremely comfortable and clean. Breakfast each day was super, with a good choice, and the location of the hotel was fantastic as all the main historic sites were in easy walking distance and there were plenty of small cafes etc around the main square (the Hippodrome). A special mention for Yunus (maybe not correct spelling!!) the young man on reception, who gave us loads of advice on what to do to make the most of our short trip - we were so pleased we took the whole day Bosphorus trip and we had a really special night at Neptun on the Galata Bridge. My advice is book into the Sultan House and splash the money you save on making the most of Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Ville M
Reviews.Content: Sultan House was very welcoming, small family hotel where service was very personal and warm. Only negative was the blankets, we felt a bit cold over nights even with 3 blankets, though bad weather may have been reason for it. Rooms were refurbished and standard was over-all nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: Georgios G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in top location - just a (very) short walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia an Topkapi palace. You easily reach Galata bridge by foot, and tram station is nearby too which brings you close to most other sights on the European side. Despite being so close to these major sights, the hotel is extremely quiet. The area seemed safe to us, but I guess you better always watch out regardless in which city you are. Sultan House location is ideal for exploring Istanbul. We stayed at Sultan House for four nights and we really enjoyed our stay. Thats not to say that you should expect luxury rooms and a chef serving extraordinary dinner. Our bathroom was pretty small, but immaticulately clean. The room was comfortable with decent furniture. Breakfast buffet was not overwhelming but definitely good. The TV has German and English channels. The hotel staff was brilliant. They gave us a 20 minute "presentation" on where to go, how to go and what to pay attention to. To sum up: Not a luyury place, but a place at which you will definitely enjoy your stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: maudes
Reviews.Content: Sultan House is clean and a FABULOUS location. Staff very warm and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Juanita S
Reviews.Content: I loved very much this hotel the room was very clean and service excellent. The mots inportant is the staff very friendly and the help us a lot. Hotel location is perfect. If i come to Istambul , I will stay is this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the friendliest hotel I've every stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: annoying2
Reviews.Content: This is a small, family-run hotel that in some ways is more like a B&B. The rooms are very clean, the location is excellent, and the staff are unfailingly helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: gleeson571
Reviews.Content: just returned from sultan house.A lovely and friendly hotel with all the comforts of home.The staff were extreamly helpful.Nice attention to detail in bedrooms and spotless throughout.Buffet breakfast was lovely and nicely presented with tea and coffee available to the guests 24 hrs a day.Within walking distance to the blue mosque,grand bizzare,spice market and many shops and restaurants.Our family will definetly return to this family owned hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ilsebein
Reviews.Content: Small intimate guesthouse with absolutely central location - 3 minutes to blue mosque. Rooms not to small - bathroom could be bigger but still ok. Nicely furnished. The roof terrace was not a place were you would like to relax more a place to store everything what is not needed. Breakfast small but fresh and tasteful. For a city trip a comfortable stay. Sleeping at night ok - you can hear the people on the street in nighttime - information for light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “"House of Happiness"”
Reviews.Author: Dashne
Reviews.Content: Well, I just came back a few weeks ago. It's a good experience to stay at Sultan House Hotel. It has a perfect location because it is close to the one of the most tourist attractions, the blue mosque, and it is located in a very quite street. Morover, it is near to the sea which you can go and get to there only 10 minutes by walking. The reception and the rooms are clean and neat. The staff are very helpful and they are kind with the guests. All I have to say is that it would be good for everyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience squared!”
Reviews.Author: Con T
Reviews.Content: A great location for Istanbuls main attractions plus great advice on restaurants. The airport pick up saves time, money and complications. I booked the return to airport through them also. The rooms are neat and extremely clean. All staff were so helpful. Only regret is that I should have stayed longer. Maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great people”
Reviews.Author: MirunaP
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect, some of the most important tourist attractions are very close to it. The room was very clean with all the facilities that you need for having a great and relaxed staying. The staff from Sultan House are very helpful, nice and kindly people. If you need any information about the city, tourist attractions, Yunus, the manager of the hotel, will help you for sure. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul Serenity”
Reviews.Author: Rick and Rhonda M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a surprise amongst the hustle and bustle of Istanbul. Our room (third floor) was in the trees with birds singing and very serene. The location is great, close to all the major attractions, the room was clean and attractive with modern touches. Yunus gave us a great introduction to the city with recommendations on tours and things to see, and he was helpful throughout our stay. The breakfast was very good. This was a great experience, would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location and great support from Yunus”
Reviews.Author: boy4767
Reviews.Content: as mentioned by other reviewer, the location is the best of all. the room was also cleaned, the free internet connection speed was also fast. Yunus may help recommend you with the local tour too and he can help you to arrange everything. the only problem that i found so far, was only no coverage of gsm phone when you stay in the basement, but it didnt really bother me as long as i got the speedy internet connection, as I contacted others using skype, viber and other video chatting software

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but we are disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: sanaa_mohey
Reviews.Content: perfect location near to sites and tram and quite as well , very clean and comfort room ,clean and home made breakfast .i stayed for 8 days with my husbend and 2 kids (15 and 9 years) but unfortunally in our last day we found a piece of my daughter clothing was disappered inspite of she was wearing it the day before . we informed the manger to check if it was collected by mistake by the housekeeper who said at once she didnt find anything , we were disappointed that the manger didnt ask her to check again which was unprofessional in my point of view .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: talkingtina
Reviews.Content: I would HIGHLY recommend The Sultan House. It is centrally located and really close to Aya of Sophia, the Blue Mosque and other tourist attractions but it is also very close to the tram and main streets of Istanbul. The staff at Sultan House are awesome! I couldn't say enough nice things about Yunus...he is a really nice person, extremely helpful and a wealth of infromation.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy location, everything you need in a short stay. Great service!”
Reviews.Author: brettg79
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in the middle of July, with my family (2 +2 small kids), and my parents. We booked the economy basement rooms, which were exactly as described. The hotel checked us in reasonably efficiently, and the location was perfect. right on the edge of the hippodrome, with a walk of about 2mins to get to the blue mosque. The breakfast served on the ground floor was fresh and tasty, with good basic ingredients. After staying 3 nights - I would certainly recommend this hotel for simple, clean and handy accommodation. The most impressive thing for me was the way Yunus, who manages the front desk, continued with his service after we departed. Unfortunately I left my new smart phone in the lobby when i departed, but after contacting the Hotel, it was freighted to me at my next stop in Turkey, and Yunus continued to follow up with the freight company until it was delivered to my door. I really appreciated the effort he went to.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Piotr_Ko
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a 10-day stay in the Sultan House in Istanbul and I must say that it was a very nice experience. The location is perfect - just one block from the main tourist attractions of the city. On the other hand, the hotel is situated in a very quiet street, so no noise will catch you there if you want to rest after a full-day visit. Overall, a very good hotel which I would definitely choose once more if I were to stay in Istanbul once more. The city is fascinating - go there if you want to experience beautiful monuments and very nice people. I highly recommend the hotel and Istanbul itself.

Reviews.Title: “excellent in a alot of ways”
Reviews.Author: jcx
Reviews.Content: excellent location, 1 block away from the hippodrome and all the attractions there. excellent, friendly and helpful staff, especially yunus. a good breakfast. small but clean and pleasant rooms. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: Yasarnajib
Reviews.Content: We had five nights stay at Sultan House. The location is ideal for those who are interested to visit historical places. The hotel is not big and have around dozen rooms, which is probably the reason every guest is being treated as personal guest by Sultan House team. For those who are accompanied with kids, I would recommend the family room. Whenever got a chance in future, I will be there again and get tour advices from Younus; whom you will find always with smiling face on front desk and planning for your trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: akorea
Reviews.Content: Booked for two nights over the internet. No problem. Friendly staff, including Yunus, the front desk manager. Decent, clean, spacious rooms. Nice breakfast to start the day. And excellent location, walking distance from the Blue Mosque and Ayasofya, Basilica Cisterna, Topkapi Palace and Divanyolu Caddesi. I would gladly recommend this hotel and stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: mlima10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located, is a quiet street of the historical area, near the major tourist sites such as the Blue Mosque. Staff is very helpful. We certainly recommend it as an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hope to get back.”
Reviews.Author: cacha28
Reviews.Content: wonderful friendly place,nice atmosphere and the photos did not lie !Also in a central position.

Reviews.Title: “Great, central, clean & friendly”
Reviews.Author: TravisW94
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and were pleasantly surprised. Friendly host, great service and spotlessly clean. Bed was a bit firm (I love a soft bed) however I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice / clean / comfortable hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Khursheed
Reviews.Content: sultan house is a nice / clean / comfortable hotel, its staff are very cooperative and friendly. we feel like a home during our stay in this hotel. location of this hotel is in the heart of Istanbul, all historic destinations are at walking distance from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great staff, we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Aslam_Family
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we could have asked for. The staff are really helpful and the location is round the corner from the Blue Mosque. We were travelling with a 3 year old and a 1 year old and the staff were very friendly towards them and always tried to help as best they could. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family and would definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable friendly hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: sebbie33
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. If you want to explore the standard sights of istanbul it is a good location. Room/bed was comfortable, with new furnishings. No double glazing, but hotel is not on a busy street so not too much road noise. Airconditioning and free wireless worked well. A tram stop is a 5 min walk away, so you can use that to get to and from the airport (I did it in 1 hr door to door at a cost of less than trl 4, you have to change tram once) or to other areas. There is a decent, but simple, restaurant around the corner and some supermarkets as well. Perfect for a solo traveller to get a quick bite to eat. I arrived at 2 am but was still met in the hotel with a friendly greeting and a complimentary cold beer (much appreciated Yunus!). Something to consider is that Sultanahmet is very touristy and therefore does not offer much of a local experience. It might be nicer to stay near Taksim square which also has nice restaurants, but a more lively nightlife and locals do go there. I stayed there when I returned and enjoyed it a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: PunainenAurinko
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in May, it was an incredible small family-run hotel offering excellent location, spacious rooms, friendly stuff, nice breakfast, and more. It takes just a minute to get from there to the Hippodrome square and the Blue Mosque, the beautiful Little Hagia Sofia mosque is also not very far. Room was clean and tidy, and it was very very quite in the hotel, it being a family business and offering just 10 rooms overall. Mine was on third floor and it provided me ample space and facilities for recreation after a busy sight-seeing day. Highly recommended to solo travelers and couples alike.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; a stone's throw from the Blue Mosque.”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_traveller097
Reviews.Content: A very nice, small boutique hotel right near all the attractions of Sultanahmet, and reasonably quiet. Having said that, the rooms are very small and the breakfast was pretty uninspiring. More variety needed than olives, hard boiled eggs and cheeses. Did appreciate the wide range of herbal teas though.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and comfortable hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: gloriabbb
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sultan House with a friend for five nights. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Additionally, the have a wonderful breakfast included and the location is perfect- next to the Hippodrome, but tucked away so that there is very little street noise. We were very happy with our choice and would highly recommend the Sultan House.

Reviews.Title: “cosy hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: elcin13
Reviews.Content: Sultan House is located in Sultanahmet, a prime neighborhood in the Old City part of Istanbul. Many historic sites such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and Basilica Cistern are walking distance (less than 5min) from the hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the room service is excellent. The breakfast is open buffet and includes a variety of yummy food and drinks. Despite being close to the center of Sultanahmet, the hotel is relatively quiet for a good night sleep. This place will definitely be my choice of accommodation in my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back !”
Reviews.Author: cekonomides
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, quiet,by the Blue Mosque. Efficient, friendly and hospitable staff to assist on 24hr basis. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for short stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: swrxp47
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located for all the sights in Sultanahmet this small family run hotel is the perfect place to stay. Located on a cobbled side street it is a one minute stroll to the Hippodrome, two minutes to the Blue Mosque and ten minutes to Aya Sofya. Turn right out of the hotel and it is a ten minute stroll downhill to little Aya Sofya. There are small shops and restaurants locally but it is only a fifteen minute stroll to all the main action. Our room on the second floor was very pleasant, light and airy. There was a little noise in the morning from children walking to school but this did not bother us. Breakfast is excellent, self serve and there was something for everyone from cereals, bread,cold meats,cheese, fruit, tea coffee etc and all very nicely presented. The reception is manned by Yunus who is very helpful and will make suggestions for restaurants and places to visit. If you want to stay in a friendly, family run hotel then I can honestly recommend Hotel Sultan House.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable, friendly hotel that is ideally located to see the main sites of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Anbers
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful, 5 night stay at the hotel. Firstly it was really helpful to have the airport pick-up service and the welcome when we arrived at Sultan House was Excellent!! The staff are so friendly and offer lots of help and gave our little son a lot of attention. We were greeted with a coffee and a hot chocolate for our son and the manager explained the main sites and how to get around on the tram which was very useful. We were then shown our very clean, spacious and comfortable room. It was as expected and we slept very well on the beds which were always well made after we returned from a long day out walking! The hotel is ideally located for the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. We walked everywhere including to the Grand Bazaar. The breakfast is very good and gives you a great start to the day and there are plenty of eating places and little mini-markets around for supplies. I would definitely recommend anyone of my friends and family to stay at Sultan House. Mr and Mrs Zaffar (and son), England

Reviews.Title: “A Classic and Comfortable Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: theshindy
Reviews.Content: As someone who lived in Istanbul for several years, this was a refreshing place to stay. It was very clean, orderly, quiet, and extremely well situated. The staff is very helpful, and want to help you enjoy your trip to Istanbul as much as possible. The rooms are lovely and the downstairs lounge is comfortable and welcoming. There is a terrace at the top of the building that provides a calm place to look at the surrounding areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great people and location, old style European room”
Reviews.Author: babow2
Reviews.Content: What makes Sultan House so great is the staff. As they said, "think of this as home, not a hotel." Everything we asked of them, they did with a smile. They were full of suggestions, help and humor. My daughter stayed at a nearby youth hostel and they welcomed and helped her, even allowed her to nibble breakfast, without a thought. The hotel is about 2 blocks from the main square in Sultanahmet, near Topkapi and Hagia Sophia. You do need to be prepared for very small rooms, and tiny bathrooms, though. You can not get two people in the bathroom. The bed's blankets don't cover a 6 foot person. It is very old style European, with cramped accommodations, but clean. They serve breakfast, but don't have a restaurant, just an eating area. No pool or exercise. Again, just a classic "vertical" small European style hotel. So, even though the room was small, the ambiance, vibe and people made it a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Felt very welcome”
Reviews.Author: pbutton
Reviews.Content: Once arrived late at night, we were welcomed very friendly. The Blue Mosque is just a couple steps away and you can walk to basically all the attractions in Sultanahmet and also to the Bazar. The room was clean, the size ok and the breakfast is very nice. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant, well-located hotel - this counts most”
Reviews.Author: Beniowski
Reviews.Content: We spent there three nights. The hotel is clean and neat, the staff are helpful and the self-service breakfast is ok. There's lots of leaflets, maps etc. available to the guests at the reception. However, the room we had booked was in the basement (I hadn't noticed that while booking the room, though the website mentions that) and it was dark (had only a window vent) and rather cold. 90 euros for such a room is too much, plus we were woken up 6 a.m by the noises from the kitchen, which is located next to that room. When we changed it for a 2-nd floor room, it was fine, though 20 euros more expensive. Overall, we were pleased to have chosen Sultan House thanks to its location, cleanness and, most of all, its great location. What is noteworthy, the hotel sorrounding is quiet, which is an advantage too.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure! welcoming, clean, right in the old city.”
Reviews.Author: jillgolden15
Reviews.Content: Sultan House Hotel is a gem, close to wonderful sites such as the Blue Mosque & Haga Sophia. The owners are friendly & helpful; the rooms are spotlessly clean and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: basum8
Reviews.Content: We arrived at noon and was well taken care of. we were offered a cup of coffee on arrival and it was a good start to stay. We were welcomed and referred to our rooms. The hotel is operated by a sweet Turkish family in a good spirit manages to create a good atmosphere around his guests. Always a smiling welcome and in the evening when some of the Turkish clubs playing people gather at the big screen in the restaurant and look at in a nice atmosphere. There was cleaned every day of our rooms and prepared beds and it was nice to come home tired to a nice room. The hotel is very centrally located in Sultanahmet area. The hotel is also child-friendly in the sense that the staff provides children with an attention which is very personal, which bear the imprint of the hotel is family driven. It is clearly a hotel that is worth visiting if you like small hotels with a personal touch and charm. Many thanks for a wonderful stay best regards Mr. Shaheed and Mrs.Gylten from Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Location and Par Excellence Service”
Reviews.Author: Hizbar
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped in we were treated like VIP's.The hotel is very neat & clean with an artistic touch. We stayed in the pent house which was very elegent.The hotel is very very near to the tram line, shopping areas,restaurants, cafes and all the historical places for which we have visited Istanbul.The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They made us feel like Home away home...I really thank Yunus for giving recommendation on places to visit and their especialities. My one year old daughter was very fond of him and Ms Hadia who loved her the same... Thanks guys for the hospitality given to us. We definately will stay again in this hotel if we visit Istanbul again. Insha Allah.

Reviews.Title: “Very good friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: nobbiSandhem
Reviews.Content: Close to all the interesting places we where coming to see. We did not need a car, could walk to everything, nice rooms, good breackfast just the way one wants a few days to be. We will, if visiting Istanbul again use this friendly house

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: hotairballoons
Reviews.Content: From the email booking to arranging a hotel transfer and asking for city information, we found the staff of Sultan House both very helpful and friendly. The hotel itself is perfectly located for exploring the centre of historic Istanbul, and is very clean. An ideal choice for those on a budget for staying in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “All good”
Reviews.Author: AndyCanmore
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring on foot, nice warm atmosphere, great service and super friendly to me and colleagues from Istanbul who enjoyed the homely feel. Spotlessly clean and great beds. I'd stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: themosquito
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right next to the Blue Mosque and you have easy access to the tram and bus station. The rooms are cosy, very clean and the staff of the hotel is excellent. The front desk manager is available 24/7 to help you navigate through the city and make sure you're pleased with your stay. Value for money. I would recommend easily as i'm very pleased for my 5night stay and i would definetly go back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Everything OK...”
Reviews.Author: SamiMaatta
Reviews.Content: ... and that is pretty much to say. The one and only thing that I mentioned to staff about was the lack of good light in the room (for reading, studying map). And that is nothing compared with the very good service etc at the Sultan House. Tram line, Hamams, Great Bazaar, Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi -- these are close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “to feel like home”
Reviews.Author: dreamon355
Reviews.Content: Really very pleased with a hotel stay.Very friendly staff.I would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Istanbul274887
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very fantastic. The staff is very freindly and helpful. We have not a problem, they help to me at everything. The room was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was good, and if we have eat an other food, they create for us. Thak you guys, thank you Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel very close to the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: CarloSilver
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome and nice play to stay after a busy day in Istanbul. We recommend it to anyone wishing to stay so close to the main attractions of the old city and in a clean, cosy and homely hotel. Comfortable beds, continental breakfast and driving service to and from the airports. We thank Yunus for his kindness and willingness to suggest itineraries.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Paul_B73
Reviews.Content: Friendly hospitality in this clean and comfortable hotel. Decent sized rooms. Good selection for buffet breakfast. Helpful advice and directions to attractions and sights near and far.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good price!”
Reviews.Author: Aubrey_83
Reviews.Content: This hotel appeared recently renovated. It was clean, the staff was friendly and spoke English. The breakfast was good. It was right near all the tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent start to a tourist's day”
Reviews.Author: patrobey
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Sultan House was a most pleasant way to start and end our travels each day around your wonderful city - Istanbul. The location in the Old Town is excellent, with easy access to the tramway, the Hippodrome, the Blue Mosque, Haija Sophia. and the Topkapi Museum and Park. The ample continental breakfast provided each day was fresh and the staff at Sultan House, always friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. There are many excellent and interesting restaurants in the area, all within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Olesrejse
Reviews.Content: We surely enjoyed our stay at this small hotel with its friendly and helpfull staff. The hotel is located few steps from the greatest highligts in Istanbul, such as The Aya Sofia, The Blue Mosque and The Roman Hippodrome With The Obelisque. The surroundings are quiet and yet in center af this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, with warmed familial atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Lawalatacilik
Reviews.Content: I know this hotel from tripadvisor. I was interesred by the room rate and when I saw the pictures, the hotel looks clean, modern furniture, good facilities and has great location. It was too perfect for the hotel with the rate like that. When we arrived, we found everything exactly as offered and seen from internet. I was travel with my husband and two kids, which one is still a baby. So I was glad that the have the facilities for baby, like baby cot and chair. Evenmore they kindly give us half price rate for the baby cot. The staffs are very friendly. Yunus, the front ofc manager, was extremely helpful to organised our trip, arraged the transport to the airport, provided us any informations and stuffs that weed needed etc. We are very satisfied with our stays in this hotel and defenitively highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience so far!”
Reviews.Author: IvanPjevic
Reviews.Content: Very nise little hotel in Sultanahmet (historical center of Istanbul). Perfectly nice and clean rooms, good service, staff that speaks english very well. If you need any information about Istanbul, you can ask at reception. At first, location doesn't seem so good but once when you get familiar with streets nearby, it's perfect and also very quiet. Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque are at 5 minutes walking distance. Also there is tram station nearby, and by tram you can get to any point in Istanbul. In rooms you have wirelles internet connection (~8MBits/s) free of charge. Last but not the least, price is very low for this quality hotel! Also you can arrange shuttle bus to Ataturk airport at very low price at reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: piazzamark
Reviews.Content: Everything has already been said - perfect location, great staff and very clean, can't think of anywhere better to stay in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Good enough replacement for trip to Egypt”
Reviews.Author: Proteuss
Reviews.Content: A month ago I decided to spent my 50-year birthday anywhere and booked very impressive hotel in Egypt. I had to refuse from it because of well-known reason two days before we started. At first Istanbul seemed to be the choise of despair. But the intensively friendly atmosphere of turkish people and especially of Sulton House staff made me to review such an attitude. If to sum it was really fine holiday in the ancient and friendly surrounding.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I've looked for”
Reviews.Author: Ekim_C
Reviews.Content: The staff are really professional and welcoming. The rooms are cosy, the breakfast fresh and location no less than perfect. Probably one of the better places to stay while in Istanbul since I've been to many hotels nearby. Worth recommending!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally and inexpensive located hotel, definetely worth it!”
Reviews.Author: PandaTrader
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at this perfectly located boutique hotel. Our choice was price and location. We wanted something cheap and perfectly located. This is Sultan House Hotel. When we arrived we were welcomed by the staff and he showed our room. It was a small room, very clean that had a TV, air conditioner, heater, safe and wireless internet. In the mornings you get a breakfast buffet with plenty of options. We would leave ealry in the morning and enjoy the city. Istanbul is magic, one of the most beautiful cities in the world, ancient filled with art and history, yet also modern with milelong shopping streets and gigantic malls. You have great nightlife and tons of options, you will defintely not get bored. When we get back from our jam packed days, we would return back to a clean room. We used only the hotel for sleeping and having breakfast. It is very central and the blue mosque, Topkapi Palast, Hagia Sofia are only 5 min walking distance away from the central hotel. So if you just need a place to stay, this is a great inexpensive choice.

Reviews.Title: “i like this hotel thats not only hotel is 1 warm house”
Reviews.Author: mehdi_rabieirad
Reviews.Content: its best place to stay in istanbul in best location and every things of this hotel was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Thank you TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: kung_fu_chick
Reviews.Content: We chose this place because of all the great reviews on TripAdvisor. Everything was true. Excellent location - within walking distance to all major attractions, affordable rate, free WiFi, and top quality service. Our room was small, but it was very clean and comfortable. My only complain was the noise level right outside our window, but we quickly got used to it and it didn't bother us. The staff was very friendly and did everything they could to keep us happy. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful comfortable corner in historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: shulinin
Reviews.Content: This place - is the best - I ever seen. Very comfortable with high quality levet, as strong european service hotel, but quite hospitality like home. The main reasons to join this hotel - nearest from historic center (2 minutes to the sultanahmet square); and good, comfortable clean rooms with WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful sultan house”
Reviews.Author: veronica_fontana
Reviews.Content: I went to istanbul with two friends and we really enjoied our staying at sultan house hotel. It is in a wonderful position, near the most important monuments, that you can reach on foot, and also to the metro and the hammam. The place is very quiet and everybody is always ready to help you finding restaurants, places to visit and to give you any kind of information you need. We couldn't find a better place!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and warm environment, excellent hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: vik2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an amazing boutique hotel, with excellent service and elegant, comfortable and very clean rooms. The hospitality and the friendly environment are quite considerable and the location of the hotel, in the heart of the old city and very close to the important monuments, is really great!

Reviews.Title: “Top location, top family-friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiercar
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 2 young kids and have just spent a wonderful 2 nights at the Sultan House en route from Madrid back to work in Shanghai. We arrived just in time for the New Year's Eve fireworks (courteous and patient pick-up service from the airport - they had to wait as we'd lost our baggage - took 40 mins to reach the hotel), and received an extremely warm welcome from the hosts of this family-run hotel, including snacks & coffee/juice and incredibly a Christmas present (engraved plate) waiting for us under the Christmas tree in the lobby !! It is a very small hotel - about 10 rooms in all - and we booked the"family room", which is a suite of 2 small rooms in the attic, newly decorated & equipped, clean and warm with extremely comfortable double beds (one in the master bedroom and a double sofa bed in the living room), flat tv for the kids, en-suite shower, minibar, and a studio-style kitchen space with tea-making equipment and a sink. In real life, the rooms are smaller than they look in the photos on the website, and are real attic rooms so you have to duck you head to reach the bathroom (hence we have scored it only 4 out of 5), but very comfortable. Next to our room we had access to a small roof terrace with close-up views of the minarets of the Blue Mosque - probably a good place to chill out if the weather is fine (too cold in Jan). Fully agree with the other reviews regarding the excellent & simple buffet breakfast, fabulous location (delightful cobbled street leading straight onto the hippodrome/blue mosque/Aya Sofia area, plenty of good cafes and restaurants nearby). One other compliment - the manager and his staff helped by calling the airport for status on our lost luggage. In short, the comfort, convenient location and excellent service at this small hotel meant we had an easy and memorable stay in the wonderful Sultanahmet quarter of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like family”
Reviews.Author: eas_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience! Great location to Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, and in the middle of Sultanahmet Square......a must for visitors to Istanbul who want to experience the old city. We were treated like family and personal kindness was shown by all the staff. We shared tea on check-in and photos with staff at check-out! We will recommend this establishment to all heading to Istanbul for a lovely, relaxing and convenient stay. The breakfast buffet is delicious and included personal requests including crepes and omelets and of course the Turkish Chai tea!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choise”
Reviews.Author: stratoniki_a
Reviews.Content: If you like small, family run hotels 'Sultan House' is the right place for you. The staff is very welcoming, polite and always willing to help, the location is f a n t a s t i c -you couldn't ask for better realy-, the place is extremely clean and the beds are really comfortable. Me and my partner we will definetely recomend it to our friends and family. The place is a small gem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tarekmsalehs
Reviews.Content: We arrivd t 5.30 AM, yet we were received with verywarm welcome, the manager gave us all th information we needed even in hat hour. Room was spacious, very clean and quite. Breakfast wa ery good. Hotel is very central, only few steps away from the Blue Mosque, 5 min walk from Aya Sophia, less tha 10 minutes walk from the Grand Bazar and the main tram lie. Surrouded by restaurants whichserve delicios Turkish food at very reasonable price. Hihly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family hotel and rich touristic area”
Reviews.Author: kenya69
Reviews.Content: It was a nice stay, the family is doing their best to make the stay comfortable and happy.The place in old city is close to important historical and cultural monuments and only few minutes. With the tramway close by, you can go far in the city and come back the same day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent affordable family friendly comfortable accomodation in central Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jennyjupiter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sultan House on our first night in Turkey and again for four nights at the end of our trip, the two of us travelling with our 7 month old baby. The hotel is in an extraordinary location and we were extremely pleased with the convenience to transports and the proximity to all the major attractions in Sultanahmet. It is literally around the corner from the Blue Mosque. Although some areas in Sultanahmet represent what we consider to be awful touristic traps, with inflated prices and hawkers on the streets, Sultan House is in a quiet street with mostly local people around. There are loads of restaurants within a very short walk of the hotel and we also recommend the restaurant nearby called Soukullu where I had the best lamb of my trip (twice) and they also have a very good meze selection which we ordered to our room via the front house manager at Sultan House when we were too tired to go out one evening. We had three dinners there when in Istanbul (including the room delivery) because the food was so good, and they even prepared homemade vegetables for our baby to eat. To be honest, we weren't that impressed with the decor in the rooms upon arrival, everything is beige and seemingly cheap, which wasn't exactly what we had in mind. But after visiting several other hotels in Turkey around the same price range, we have to say that Sultan House is certainly worth it. Its true, the beds are extremely comfortable, the showers are hot with good water pressure, they have a hair dryer in the room and the rooms are clean and adequate. The wireless internet is excellent, reliable and free. We slept well at Sultan House, although on weekdays there are school kids that mill around outside enroute to school that did make a bit of noise on the street, but this really didn't bother us because we weren't in Istanbul to sleep late and miss the days out. Anyway, the breakfasts from 7:30AM were really good and they always had something extra each day, omlette, pancakes, sweet cakes and special breads were served for instance when we were there, in addition to the normal Turkish breakfast options (note, no fruit juices were served but I'm fairly sure if I had asked they would have gone out of their way to accommodate me). Sultan House is a family run operation and the family are very hospitable to all of their guests. They made us, and especially our baby, feel extremely welcome. I would happily stay at Sultan House again when in Istanbul. I sincerely hope that the increase in their popularity which I'm sure will bring them even more business will not ruin the comfortable atmosphere that they already have in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel, Excellent location, Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkWorldExplorer
Reviews.Content: This is a newly opened, small family run hotel in the Sultanahmet area. The rooms as pictured in their website are accurate. The rooms are very clean and have all the basic hotel amenities (fresh towels, safe, TV, shampoo, shower cap etc.). Wifi is excellent and breakfast is good. It is located in a quaint cobble stoned street and conveniently near all the major sights. If you are looking for a clean, no frills hotel with all the basic amenities and friendly warm and personal service at a great value, then this is the place. You cannot compare this to the large chain or luxury hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine Turkish hospitality with first-class service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Carol155019
Reviews.Content: I stayed my first night in Istanbul at Best Western Empress Palace - comfortable but very anonymous and impersonal - also right next to tramway. So I wandered around the Sultanahmet area looking for a cheaper and more genuine alternative. The Sultan House beckoned as it was very clean and light as opposed to some others which look rather grubby and dark. The front desk manager made me feel instantly at home - I moved in and stayed for a week - what I really liked was the combination of genuine Turkish hospitality and friendliness with amenities that I would normally associate with a more expensive hotel - room safe, mini bar, CNN and BBC news on TV in English, spotlessly clean bathroom, free shampoo etc. and the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. Mr. Sayim arranged my airport transfer (only 5 euros) and made me coffee at 3 a.m. and offered me a sandwich for my journey, and stood at the door waving goodbye. I would definitely recommend this hotel - oh, and its location is fantastic. The breakfast was very good with home made crepes, borek, etc. They don't have a full service restaurant yet but Mr. Sayim's friend down the road about 50 feet from the hotel has a restaurant called Sokullu where I ate several times and it is a cut above the tourist traps on the main road and also very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “New, cosy, good value, family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: nrozabut
Reviews.Content: Sultan House is a newly established, lovely, small, family run hotel which is fairly well located (although not in an area with many restaurants). It is within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and Topkapi Palace and located in a quiet area. The hotel staff are very friendly, helpful, eager to please and made our stay enjoyable. The breakfast is typical Turkish fare and is tasty and fresh. The rooms are on the small side (particularly the bathrroms) but are still comfortable. There is a lovely restaurant with delicious food just down the road called Sokkulu and it is well worth visting. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommned this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Warm hospitality in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: RovshanBaku
Reviews.Content: First of all before going to Turkey I was looking for the best hotel in Sultan-Ahmed territory. The Sultan-Ahmed territory is famous historic tourist occupied place for sightseeing in Istanbul. It was my first trip to Istanbul with wife so I was trying to find out that place where we will have the best relax and comfort mainly. The hotel location is perfect just five minutes by walk to Sultan-Ahmed Mosque and Haga-Sofya palace. The operation manager had shown an excellent professionalism and very good negotiation skills during our stay in the Sultan-House hotel. The hotel room were very clean and tidy. The breakfast was very tasty with home made delicious starters. I would like to bring my thanks to all hotel operation stuff for theirs warm hospitality especially to operation manager. I would definitely stay in this hotel on my next trip to Istanbul. My advice to travelers this hotel is the best option for staying and visiting main ancient buildings in Istanbul. Best Wishes! Rovshan Bayramov

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Lia601
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice and quiet hotel on the heart of Sultanhamet area, this is the place. If you want to feel like at your home, this is the place. This hotel will be my place for each travell on Istanbul. The owner and all staff are near with you and they are showing a kindly ospitality. Excellent.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sultan House
HotelInfo.Address: Binbir Direk Mahallesi Dizdariye Cesme Sokak No: 1 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
